page.title: 14BIRD LIFE _ FOREST OF DEAN
page.content: This is an outstanding area for birds both in terms of variety and number.The most common bird on the river is the{Mallard Duck}which nests in the woods away from water-loving predators. In the rocks and rapids the {Dipper}canbe seen. The{Buzzard}is the most common day-time predator and at night many {Owls}can be seen. The forest makes an ideal home for rare birds found only in England and Wales. A good example is the{Bowfinch.}The trees form nesting sites for many species and the bird population would be greatly affected by tree felling during the Spring and Summer nesting seasons.To avoid this problem the{ {Forestry Commission}does most of its felling during the Winter.
